alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Santa Monica Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 27 at 1:35AM PDT until August 28 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM PDT THIS MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves due to elevated surf of 3 to 6 feet expected. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Santa Monica Mountains and Los Angeles County Beaches. The highest waves are expected on south facing beaches. * WHEN...From 6 AM PDT this morning through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Santa Monica Mountains
